page.title: 01Land West of Fillongley
page.content:
This area, which lies directly west of Fillongley village, forms part of the old "Forest of Aren". The undulating landscape is broken by narrow roads and fields enclosed by ancient hedges with only sporadic areas of woodland still remaining.
Houses and cottages are often isolated, with only small groups of dwellings forming settlements, as is the case in Chapel Green where there are a dozen or so cottages.
The land use is predominately agriculture, with the area roughly divided 2/5th rough pasture, 2/5th crop and 1/5th woodland.
The majority of people live and work on the land with only a small number
